results.title: Bali: the release of a soul
results.creator_credit: John Phillips, Ted Myers and United Cinema
results.brief_description: To the Balinese, life and religion are one. The film explains this as it explains some aspects of the school system, religion and village life, to the accompaniment of gamelan music.

results.title: Bali: the island paradise
results.brief_description: An introduction to Bali emphasising village life, agriculture and culture with a focus on traditional dancing. Narrated by James A. FitzPatrick.
results.description: An introduction to Bali emphasising village life, agriculture and culture with a focus on traditional dancing. Narrated by James A. FitzPatrick.

results.title: Bali today
results.brief_description: Illustrates life on the small volcanic island of Bali in Indonesia. Emphasises the role of the Brahmin religion in everyday life, with scenes of the rice harvest, colourful dance ceremonies, and flower offerings to the gods. Examples of weaving and mask-making illustrates Balinese art. No other credits available.

results.title: Balance 1950
results.brief_description: Animated drawings showing the balance sheet of Imperial Chemical Industries for 1950. Vivacious little “match stick” men, aided by ever active “Pound” and other devices perform against a backdrop of graphs and ledgers. An interesting example of simplified animation technique in which an unpopular subject is treated in an entertaining way.

results.title: Balalaika
results.creator_credit: Reinhold Schunzel, Lawrence Weingarten and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: An elicit relationship evolves between a Russian prince and a lovely cafe singer, a relationship that is seemingly doomed for these star-crossed lovers at a time when Russia is facing political upheaval. A romantic musical drama featuring Nelson Eddy, Ilona Massey, Charlie Ruggles, Frank Morgan, Lionel Atwill, C. Aubrey Smith.

results.title: Balada O Podravini
results.brief_description: A big, featherless bird helps us discover Podravina and its inhabitants. It is autumn, the crops are in, and we are invited to a country fair and a funeral. We understand how the peasants approach life and the world around them through this animated film.
results.description: A big, featherless bird helps us discover Podravina and its inhabitants. It is autumn, the crops are in, and we are invited to a country fair and a funeral. We understand how the peasants approach life and the world around them through this animated film.

results.title: Balablok
results.creator_credit: Brent Walker Film Productions, Rene Jodoin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated replay of the human comedy as amusing in its perception as in the way it caricatures man’s propensity to resort to violence rather than reason. The whole area of conflict is reduced to its simplest dimensions - cubes and balls representing opposing protagonists. Why they fight and what happens after the battle is a parody of human nature. A film without commentary. (Awards: Palme d’Or, Cannes; Colombo; Buenos Aires)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brent Walker Film Productions, Rene Jodoin and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Baking unleavened bread: Pushtu Nomads
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Reveals the simple but physically demanding life of the nomadic Pushtu. Shows a Pushtu wife skilfully fashioning large flat discs of dough and baking each separately by pressing it into the convex side of a great copper pan. Suitable for Upper Primary-Middle Secondary students.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hermann Schlenker, Julien Bryan and International Film Foundation

results.title: Bakhtiari migration. [Edited version]
results.creator_credit: Anthony Howarth, David Koff and Anthony-David Productions
results.brief_description: An excellent record of one of the most hazardous feats of human endurance still undertaken. Shows the way in which half a million people together with millions of valuable sheep, goats, mules, and dogs struggle for five weeks to make the two hundred mile crossing of the Zagros mountains in southern Iran.

results.title: Bakery beat
results.brief_description: Gives a step-by-step account of the making of bread, using many close-ups and showing the comparison between a small two man bakery and a large automated one. This film is non-narrated with a music soundtrack and is applicable to themes of interdependence and social organization. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
